meanings.definition: A game played on a square board with pockets at each corner, in which players use a striker to pocket their own pieces and the opponent's pieces.
meanings.sent1: During the carrom game, players aim to pocket the pieces using the striker.
meanings.sent2: Let's set up the carrom board and start playing the game.
meanings.sent3: In the carrom match, Sarah's striker skillfully pocketed all the pieces in one turn.
meanings.sent4: The carrom board became a battlefield where the strikers fought to pocket the pieces.
meanings.sent5: The sound of pieces being pocketed echoed through the room during the intense carrom match.

meanings.definition: To pocket a piece in the game of carrom.
meanings.sent1: She tried to carrom the black piece but missed by a hair's breadth.
meanings.sent2: If you carrom the opponent's piece, you gain an advantage in the game.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally carromed his own piece, much to the amusement of the other players.
meanings.sent4: Her swift move to carrom the last piece left everyone in awe of her skills.
meanings.sent5: With a steady hand, he managed to carrom the final piece and win the game.
